newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Ciputra sees 1997 net down on rupiah.
newsitem.headline: Ciputra sees 1997 net down on rupiah.

text.p: Indonesian property firm PT Ciputra Development has said it will post lower net profit in 1997 against the previous year because of the depreciation in the rupiah, the Jakarta Post reported on Saturday.
The newspaper quoted company officials as forecasting 1997 net profit at 156.36 billion rupiah against 163 billion rupiah in 1996.
"The current rupiah depreciation would cut down profit by about 15 billion rupiah this year," it quoted managing director Harun Hajadi as saying.
He said half the company's debt was denominated in dollars but some revenue was also denominated in the U.S. currency. He gave no figures.
The rupiah has fallen over 20 percent this year against the dollar with most of the weakness coming in the past three weeks.
